decks.notes: This deck focuses on cycling through cards to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures, then cast Living End to board wipe and bring them all back into play. It utilizes cards like Street Wraith and Curator of Mysteries to cycle through the deck efficiently, while also running counterspells like Force of Negation to protect the combo. By utilizing the cascade mechanic with cards like Shardless Agent, the deck can consistently find Living End and other key pieces. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a sudden board presence and win quickly.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays while also disrupting your opponent's game plan with cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Prismatic Ending. Quantum Riddler and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd provide support and card advantage. Consign to Memory and Solitude help control the board while also dealing damage. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker. By utilizing a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells, this deck aims to pressure the opponent and come out victorious in the end.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls, supported by powerful spells such as Galvanic Discharge and Thraben Charm. The deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creature damage and direct burn spells. The inclusion of powerful planeswalkers like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah adds additional versatility and threat to the deck. Additionally, cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Goblin Bombardment provide alternative win conditions and ways to close out games efficiently.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures such as Archon of Cruelty and Emperor of Bones, and then bring them back onto the battlefield using cards like Persist and Unearth. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Negation and Fatal Push to control the opponent's plays. By combining reanimation strategies with combo potential, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and disrupt their game plan, ultimately securing a victory through a flurry of hard-hitting attacks.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly assemble a board presence and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive and efficient plays. By utilizing artifact creatures and powerful artifacts like Urza's Saga and Engineered Explosives, the deck aims to generate value and continuous threats. Emry, Lurker of the Loch provides recursion and card advantage, while cards like Metallic Rebuke and Tormod's Crypt help disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck is designed to apply early pressure and maintain control over the game with a mix of artifacts and aggressive creatures.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with lands like Gruul Turf and Arboreal Grazer to get Primeval Titan onto the battlefield. Once Primeval Titan is out, the deck can tutor for lands like Urza's Saga and Lotus Field to generate even more mana. This allows the player to cast big spells like Scapeshift to find win conditions like Vesuva and Malevolent Rumble, or to search for more Primeval Titans. The key strategy is to assemble the right combination of lands and spells to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats and efficient mana production.

The main idea of this Ruby Storm deck is to quickly generate mana with cards like Ruby Medallion, Pyretic Ritual, and Desperate Ritual, while casting spells like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Glimpse the Impossible to draw cards and deal damage to the opponent. The deck aims to combo off with cards like Past in Flames and Artist's Talent to create a storm count and finish off the opponent with cards like Grapeshot. The deck is focused on fast mana generation and creating a powerful storm turn to win the game.

This deck focuses on using the UrzaTron lands to generate a lot of mana quickly in order to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Sire of Seven Deaths. It also includes strong control elements like Ugin, Karn, and Kozilek's Command to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to control the board and outvalue the opponent with its big threats, while also having access to removal spells like Dismember to deal with threats. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to ramp up quickly and overwhelm the opponent with its powerful creatures and spells.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on early aggression and utilizing the synergy between cards like Ragavan, Seasoned Pyromancer, and Goblin Bombardment to keep up the pressure on the opponent. It also incorporates a control aspect with cards like Mana Tithe and Thraben Charm to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of cards like Voice of Victory and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah provide additional ways to finish off the opponent. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creatures and burn spells in a fast-paced aggressive strategy.

The key concept of this deck is to aggressively fill up the graveyard with cards like Faithless Looting and Burning Inquiry to quickly bring out powerful creatures like Hollow One and Detective's Phoenix. The deck also utilizes cards like Marauding Mako and Inti, Seneschal of the Sun to maintain board presence and apply pressure on the opponent. With a mix of efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat, as well as disruptive cards like Thoughtseize, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and relentless assault.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana through cards like Arboreal Grazer and Amulet of Vigor to cast Primeval Titan and search for powerful lands like Urza's Saga and Vesuva. The goal is to assemble a powerful board state with multiple lands in play to overwhelm the opponent and potentially win with cards like Scapeshift or Hanweir Battlements. The deck also utilizes cards like Explore and Cultivator Colossus to maintain card advantage and further accelerate its game plan.

The deck focuses on utilizing a toolbox of creatures to assemble powerful combos and generate value. It includes cards that provide card advantage, ramp, protection, and synergy with other creatures. The deck aims to control the board and create advantageous situations through the interaction of its creature cards. By utilizing cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Spymaster's Vault, the deck can efficiently search for and play key creatures to create a dominant board state and overwhelm the opponent.

The deck revolves around quickly deploying artifacts onto the battlefield to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and disruption. Cards like Engineered Explosives, Mishra's Bauble, and Urza's Saga are used to generate value and provide additional resources. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Kappa Cannoneer serve as efficient threats, while Metallic Rebuke and Tormod's Crypt disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of Claws of Gix and Weapons Manufacturing allows for sacrificing artifacts for additional benefits. Overall, the deck aims to utilize the power of artifacts to rapidly close out games with a combination of aggression and disruption.

This deck revolves around the strategy of milling your opponent's library to win the game, utilizing cards like Hedron Crab, Ruin Crab, and Fractured Sanity to mill cards quickly. The main goal is to trigger Archive Trap for free when your opponent searches their library, as well as using cards like Visions of Beyond and Tasha's Hideous Laughter for card advantage and disruption. The deck also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Drown in the Loch to control the board while setting up the mill win condition.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by using counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers like Narset and Teferi. It focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while drawing cards and maintaining card advantage. The deck also utilizes various lands and artifacts to help stabilize the board and protect key pieces. Additionally, it includes some unique cards like Orim's Chant and Day's Undoing to further hinder the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and eventually win through incremental advantage.

The deck focuses on playing powerful colorless creatures and enchantments to control the game and overwhelm the opponent with large threats. The key is to assemble UrzaTron lands to gain access to a large amount of mana quickly, allowing for casting of expensive spells early in the game. The deck utilizes powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger, alongside control cards like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Karn, the Great Creator, to dominate the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy.
